title: TiMi F1 Montreal – Senior Tools & Pipeline Programmer
responsibilities: Award-winning TiMi Studio Group seeks a Senior Tools & Pipeline Programmer to develop a AAA, open-world game using Unreal’s latest technology. The project will be released on multiple platforms, with an objective to reach a global audience. As a Senior Tools & Pipeline Programmer, you will develop features that empower content creators with a focus on productivity and scalability. TiMi Montreal is a new studio within TiMi Studio Group, a subsidiary of Tencent Games. We are passionate about creating compelling worlds for players to explore for years to come. Are you someone who loves participating in building new worlds, understands what captivates players, and cares deeply about gaming as a medium? Are you ready to channel your passion and energy into creating expansive open world games for global audiences? Are you passionate about building technology that supports a unique creative vision? Then, come join us in our ambitious endeavor. What will you do? You will design and develop features that allow content creators to produce high quality content. You will work closely with artists and designers to find creative solutions that respond to their needs. You will participate in continuous improvements of our tools & pipeline based on user feedback. You will establish the foundations for a productive and scalable work environment. Implement technology that supports our game vision and empowers content creators Collaborate with artists, designers, animators to design solutions that respond to their needs Measure pipeline performance for continuous improvement Debug and troubleshoot issues within our pipeline Maintain high quality coding standards and documentation Focus on productivity, scalability and efficiency
qualifications: What we are looking for: At least eight years of professional AAA game development experience At least two AAA action titles shipped, one during the current generation of video games (PS4 / XBOX ONE) Broad knowledge of game content creation pipelines Proficiency in various programming languages, especially C# and C++ Excellent debugging and optimization skills Good analytical skills Ability to quickly prototype and iterate in collaboration with others Experience with Unreal Engine is a plus Experience with Live Service games is a plus What is in it for you? Create new worlds for players to explore, experience and enjoy: At TiMi Montreal, we see everyone as a game developer. Join a team of industry veterans to create engaging and innovative experiences that players will enjoy for years to come. Share your passion, your ideas and take initiative to increase our product’s quality. Deliver AAA multi-platform games with ample resources and support: TiMi is dedicated to bringing incredible game experiences to players. As one of the most successful studios in the world, TiMi has what it takes to produce a AAA game. We wish to empower all game developers to reach their full potential.

title: Localization Manager
responsibilities: - Work with multiple internal stakeholders, including HQ Localization Team, marketing, operations, and community teams to define success criteria for in-game and publishing localization. - Become point-of-contact between WEU Regional Publishing Team and Tencent HQ to identify opportunities for improvement and optimizing content. - Co-manage vendors with Tencent HQ to improve the quality of in-game localization of the supported languages and V / Os. - Work with vendors to ensure all publishing related-content is localized into supported languages. - Coordinate localization requirements between the development team and other regional departments – publishing, marketing, operation, esports. - Project follow-up and controlling to meet quality standards, budget and deadlines.
qualifications: - 5+ years of experience in localization, QA and product roles in gaming. - Proficiency in one or more non-English European languages (French, German, Spanish or Italian and Mandarin is a plus) - Understanding the unique challenges of localizing and publishing mobile MOBA games and games-as-a-service. - Ability to work under pressure and manage ambiguous situations. - Proven experience in localization tools. - A passion for mobile, pc and console games. - A valid passport and willingness to travel regularly to London.

title: TiMi F1 Montreal – Character Artist
responsibilities: Award-winning TiMi Studio Group seeks a Character Artist to develop a AAA, open-world game based on a new IP. The project will be released on multiple platforms, with an objective to reach a global audience. As a Character Artist, you will create high-quality characters based on our unique artistic direction. Every character you produce will contribute to building a living, dynamic and engaging world. TiMi Montreal is a new studio within TiMi Studio Group, a subsidiary of Tencent Games. We are passionate about creating compelling worlds for players to explore for years to come. Are you someone who loves participating in building new worlds, understands what captivates audiences, and cares deeply about gaming as a medium? Are you ready to channel your passion and energy into creating expansive open world games for global audiences? Then, come join us in our ambitious endeavor. What will you do? You will participate in bringing a unique cast of characters to life. You will work with art direction to define our character art style, using different proportions, silhouettes and shading techniques. You will collaborate with animators to create characters that players can interact with in a memorable way. Create high-quality 3D models / textures for characters and creatures Integrate characters in-engine following technical requirements (polycount, etc. ) Validate characters respect in-game lighting and shading requirements Collaborate with animators and technical animators to provide them with animatable elements Contribute to character art pipeline and rendering improvements Optimize character models based on engine constraints TiMi Montreal is a new studio within TiMi Studio Group, a subsidiary of Tencent Games. We are passionate about creating compelling worlds for players to explore for years to come. Are you someone who loves participating in building new worlds, understands what captivates players, and cares deeply about gaming as a medium? Are you ready to channel your passion and energy into creating expansive open world games for global audiences? Are you passionate about the combination of technology, animation, and gameplay? Then, come join us in our ambitious endeavor. What will you do? You will collaborate directly with our animation team to develop technology supporting our creative vision. You will build animation systems that are scalable and sustainable in a live-service context. Your contribution will allow animators to reach the highest-level of realization quality. We believe animation plays a major role in the success of our new franchise. Implement animation systems and technology based on our creative vision Collaborate with animators, technical animators and programmers to develop high-quality software Analyze existing tools and software that could be integrated in our pipeline Iterate to reach highest animation quality Debug and optimize animation systems for an Open World game Develop debugging tools for content creators Respect high quality coding standards Write and maintain technical documentation
qualifications: What we are looking for: Expert knowledge of character creation tools (ZBrush, Substance Painter, 3DSMax, Maya, Photoshop, Marevelous Designer, etc. ) Strong portfolio showcasing modeling, texturing and rendering skills Good understanding of real-time rendering concepts (shaders, polycount, PBR, etc. ) Strong high & low resolution character modeling Good understanding of human anatomy Knowledge of movie and games industry Experience with Unreal Engine is a plus Experience in professional AAA game development experience preferred What is in it for you? Create new worlds for players to explore, experience and enjoy: At TiMi Montreal, we see everyone as a game developer. Join a team of industry veterans to create engaging and innovative experiences that players will enjoy for years to come. Share your passion, your ideas and take initiative to increase our product’s quality. Deliver AAA multi-platform games with ample resources and support: TiMi is dedicated to bringing incredible game experiences to players. As one of the most successful studios in the world, TiMi has what it takes to produce a AAA game. We wish to empower all game developers to reach their full potential.

title: Senior Researcher
responsibilities: - Research, develop, implement and optimize algorithms and software solutions related to 3D computer vision and scene understanding, 3D reconstruction, vision robot SLAM, or human pose estimation - Create production level code that is elegant, efficient, and maintainable - Take accountability for solutions that are modular and testable - Build unit testing to prove that your code and solutions truly work - Work closely with hardware and other software engineering teams on tech selections and solutions - When necessary, debug, optimise and aspire to make things excellent
qualifications: - Must hold a Master / MPhil or above degree in computer science, computer vision, computer graphics, robotics, video game programming, or machine learning, or have suitable alternate expertise and experience - Proven track record in research excellence as evidenced by published in at least one of the following conferences as an author, SIGGRAPH, CVPR, ICCV, ECCV, ACCV, WACV, BMVC, ICCP, ISMAR, NeurlPS, ICLR, ICRA, IROS, RSS, or in major CV / CG / Robotics / Machine learning journals - Must be passionate about generating new ideas, solving problems, and building working systems - Must be self-motivated, proven collaborators, good communicators, attentive to details, and keen to learn - Ideally have practical experience working in an academic or industrial research environment - Must have research or development experience in one or more of the following areas: - 3D computer vision, ideally including experience of pose estimation - Deep learning, representation learning, transfer learning - 3D computer graphics, real time rendering algorithm development - Robot SLAM and dense mapping - SFM, stereo, optical flow, and 3D visual reconstruction - Image semantic segmentation and scene understanding - 3D point clouds, mesh and surface geometry model compression - Neural rendering and novel view synthesis - Camera calibration and multi-view geometry - Must be strong computer programmers with software engineering experience and good code-testing and debugging skills. Experience in the following would be advantageous: - Fluent in Python and C / C++ with at least 3 years of experience writing quality code - GPU programming (especially CUDA) - High-level and low-level CPU / DSP level code optimization - Must have strong mathematical skills, familiar with Probability and statistics, and or numerical algorithms, e. g. nonlinear optimization such as Eigen, G2O, Ceres, Levenberg-Marquardt, Gauss-Newton, sparse solver, BLAS, and bundle adjustment - Track record of shipping working code and solutions based on your ideas - Team player, ability to perform in cross functional teams and to share knowledge to others - Good communication skills in English

title: Marketing Intern
responsibilities: 1．The candidates will be join in overseas marketing of shooting games, including brand design, new product marketing strategy plans and budget resource management; 2．The candidates are required to coordinate the execution of market creative design, media placement, public relations communication, event marketing and other modules; 3．The candidates are required to facilitate product launch and business target achievement.

title: Machine Learning Researcher (Internship)
responsibilities: Responsibilities: - Research on machine learning / deep learning algorithms and follow up with the latest researches. - Build data-driven game products, including product analysis, algorithm design, implementation and maintenance.
qualifications: - MS / PhD in Computer Science, mathematics, statistics or other related fields. - Familiar with at least one programing language, e. g. Python / C++ / Scala / SQL / R is required. - Good knowledge in statistical analysis (probabilities, hypothesis testing, multivariate analysis, time series analysis, generalized linear model, A / B test) is preferred. - Experience with large-scale data analysis frameworks such as Hadoop or Spark is preferred. - Publications in relevant Tier 1 conference / journal is preferred. - Good knowledge in reinforcement learning, recommendation system, natural language processing or computer vision is preferred.

title: Software Engineering Intern (2023 graduate)
responsibilities: Role: We are looking for highly motivated college students to join our team. As an intern, you will work on a real project (or a few) and have an opportunity to enjoy our dynamic environment and culture. you will collaborate with multi-functional teams, receive mentorship, and gain insight into our value-driven process. Our goal is both to support your growth and development while empowering you for a successful start to your career. Responsibilities: As a Software Engineer Intern, * You will build innovative solutions that enable rapid development. You will get to work with smart and hardworking individuals who are doing state of the art development work in areas of anti-cheating, content moderating and large-scale event streaming to deliver best-in-class business value to our customers. You will be interacting with product management and customers to understand detailed requirements. You will also work with other engineering teams across the organization to design and build high-performance solutions. * You will design, develop, code and test software systems, or applications for software improvements and new products * You will actively contribute through participation in multiple phases of the agile development * Your feedback will influence our processes and procedures, and will directly contribute to standard methodologies, architecture, and implementation.
qualifications: - Bachelor’s, Master’s, or PhD in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Mathematics or a related technical field, and a strong record of academic achievement. - Familiarity with object-oriented programming concepts, large-scale software architecture, networking and distributed systems, and UNIX / Linux environments - Familiarity with some of the following programming languages including but not limited to Go, C++, Java, Python, Javascript - Familiarity with REST API and micro-services - Familiarity with CI / CD concepts - Familiarity with tools and technologies like Git, Jenkins, Gitlab, AWS, Docker, GCP - Experience building meaningful software applications: in a class, as a personal hobby, as a job, or as part of an open source project - You enjoy collaborating with others in a fast-paced environment - Strong communication skills, verbal and written

title: Graphics expert
responsibilities: We are looking for a graphics expert to join our R&D team. The aim is to research and develop graphics / rendering techniques with a solid eye towards being usable in future games. In particular, we are looking for techniques for large scale rendering, dynamic direct and indirect lighting, procedural geometry construction, dynamic destruction, and general improvements to fidelity or performance. If you are interested in pushing the boundaries of graphics in large-scale, dynamic worlds, apply now! Responsibilities Researching as well as implementing novel, or improvements to state of art, graphics techniques for use in upcomings games or as part of the production of same Stay up to date with current research in the domain of real-time computer graphics and games Collaborating with other Tencent teams and studios to ensure techniques are useful in upcoming titles and on current and next generation hardware platforms
qualifications: Requirements Very solid experience with modern GPU programming using DX12, Vulkan, console APIs, or equivalent APIs Experience with the use of compute shaders and, preferably, ray-tracing and mesh shaders Hands-on experience with implementing modern GPU techniques such as temporal anti-aliasing, volumetric effects, shadowing techniques, or similar Experience with debugging, profiling, and optimizing code on both CPU and GPU Strong familiarity with modern C++ multi-threaded programming. Experience with shipped games Preferred skills Experience working with Unreal, Unity, or comparable in-house engines Experience with streaming systems and / or open-world games Console optimization and debugging experience MSc or PhD in a relevant area

responsibilities: We are setting up a new R&D cell to focus on improving the state-of-art of animation technology for our upcoming titles. This includes developing techniques for the in-game runtime, targeting improved fidelity, compression, motion synthesis, as well as animation production time tooling and techniques. Responsibilities Researching as well as implementing novel, or improvements to state of art, animation techniques for use in upcomings games or as part of the production of same Stay up to date with current research in the domain of real-time animation in the context of computer games Collaborating with other Tencent teams and studios to ensure that the techniques being developed are useful in upcoming titles and on current and next generation hardware platforms
qualifications: Requirements Solid experience with modern animation programming techniques, for example multi-joint IK, motion matching, motion fields, animation compression, etc. Experience with debugging, profiling, and optimizing CPU code Understanding of related topics: animator workflows, mocap data cleaning, skinning techniques, game character / NPC locomotion, … Experience with shipped games Preferred skills Experience working with Unreal, Unity, or comparable in-house engines Experience with streaming systems and / or open-world games Console optimization and debugging experience MSc or PhD in a relevant area

title: Live Ops Manager, AoV (Western Europe)
responsibilities: The Live Ops Manager, Arena of Valor (Western Europe) will have the opportunity to be part of a newly formed team in the region, focused on the AoV franchise. The role is responsible for the communication and cooperation with the R&D and middle platform departments, planning all localised game content for the region including but not limited to region relevant in-game characters, character skins & cosmetics and other special programmes. The Operations Manager will work cross functionally across the team to identify market specific opportunities that can be bought to life in the game to drive player growth and engagement. The performance of these programmes will be continuously monitored vs goals. Responsibilities −Analyse AoV player data and competitive data sets to understand the behavior of the current AoV player base in context of the marketplace. −Work with multiple internal stakeholders including player insights, marketing and community leads from each territory cluster to design impactful programmes tuned to player needs in each market. −Partner with marketing team to understand key cultural moments in each market and identify ways for AoV to participate via new in-game content or events programmes connected to these cultural events. −Lead the data and reporting function for AoV, Western Europe. Establish a daily data monitoring mechanism for key performance indicators, regularly presenting output conclusions and reports to the broader team, undertake ad hoc data analysis and output insights on key in-game player trends / variations by market. −Monitor competitive campaigns and their performance, sharing best practice examples across partner teams to help drive organisational learning and development. −Share ideas and best practice with other AoV regional teams around the world and integrate learnings into the Western European team. −Manage one direct report – Performance Analyst & Insights Manager. −Travel regularly to central London to meet with the full regional AoV team at Tencent.
qualifications: −A passion for MOBA games. −Minimum 3 years experience working in Live Ops, games localisation or other games related roles, either within PC & console or mobile gaming. −Excellent analytical skills and the ability to summarise data into clear & tangible recommendations. −Deep immersion in & understanding of culture & pop-culture in multiple European countries. −Versatile project manager able to drill down into detail and clearly think through project timelines & interdependencies. −Bachelor degree or above. −English language proficiency. −A strategic thinker with the ability to conceptualise broadly across various solutions, yet enjoy operating at a hands-on level. −Passionate, committed, self-starter with high levels of initiative, energy, ownership, urgency and a sincere willingness to learn from global team members at all levels. −Strong influencing skills and the ability to effectively engage with a wide variety of stakeholders. −Able to work under pressure and find solutions to multiple and varying needs. −Outstanding written and oral skills, to build productive relationships. −Proactive and approachable personality that thrives in a dynamic team environment. −Valid passport and willingness to travel regularly to London.

title: Community Manager, AoV Europe
responsibilities: The Community Manager, Arena of Valor (UK & Nordics) will have the opportunity to be part of a newly formed team in Western Europe leading community engagement for AoV, a MOBA game available on mobile platforms. You will be AoV mobile's online voice on multiple social platforms for the UK and Nordic markets. Acting as a bridge between the community and the developers, you will represent the game team to the community including designing and implementing community programmes, providing game updates, reporting on community trends and troubleshooting issues. Main duties will involve: - Working with multiple internal stakeholders including player insights, marketing, operations and community leads from other territory clusters to devise and deliver community centric programs. - Create, manage and post on AoV social media channels including Twitter, Facebook, Instagram and Discord. - Work in partnership with PR team and own the relationship of key members and influencers of the player community and content creators who have local significance. - Create player-facing resources and content such as guides, videos, FAQs to help enhance and deepen the player experience. - Teasing upcoming releases for features and programs. - Monitor and evaluate impact of community programs, sentiment of players, and community influencer outreach programs for continued improvement by providing insight to the Western European marketing team. - Be the internal community advocate and provide relevant feedback that represents the players. - Participating in the scheduling and creation of on-line and off-line events. - You will need to maintain consistent and positive presence in discussion forums in order to understand the state of the community and what they need. - Partner with AoV Western European eSports lead to bring tournaments and exhibition matches to life within territory cluster. - Based either in the UK or Sweden, you will be required to travel regularly to central London to meet with the full regional AoV team at Tencent.
qualifications: - English language proficiency. - A passion for MOBA games. - At least 2 years working experience in a community or Live Ops support role within mobile gaming. - Experience creating assets for a community (e. g. streaming, video, gifs, or photoshopped images) is essential for this role. - Understanding of streaming & knowledge of e-sports. - Passionate, committed, self-starter with high levels of initiative, energy, ownership and urgency. - Able to work under pressure and find solutions to multiple and varying needs. - Valid passport and willingness to travel regularly to London.

title: Senior HR Manager
responsibilities: - Oversee all aspects of HR, focusing on localization efforts and ensuring a best in class employee life-cycle experience while overseeing aligning between HR strategy and overall business plans - Partners closely with country GM and HQ closely to roll out people initiatives, particularly Talent & Culture building and HR Compliance - Advise the leadership team on management issues and effectively implements new or improved programs, policies, and processes to mitigate risk; - Be the point of contact for all HR operational matters such as performance, conduct, capability, and provide the necessary support to ensure the issues are managed in line with company policy, best practice and current legislation - Advise employees on the company's HR policies, processes and procedures; - Handle Ad-hoc human resources projects.
qualifications: - Possess strong awareness of local market trends, best practices and to consistently share and improve on the company offering to help grow Tencent’s businesses and branding - Strong team player who is highly collaborative and portrays a customer obsessed mindset - Someone who enjoys growing the organization from 0 to 1 and is passionate about what they do - Able to understand local laws and regulations and to also adapt to international cultural nuances - Strong communication capabilities with not just in-country employees but HQ colleagues as well - Fluency in Japanese & English is a must; ability to communicate in Mandarin will be a strong advantage

title: Senior IT Engineer
responsibilities: - Collaborate with HR, Admin and Operations team to provide the best IT solutions and user experience for Tencent employees, as well as affiliate users. - Provide support, troubleshooting and resolve problems to meet end user ‘s satisfaction, including IT hardware, IT systems, business platforms and applications. - Participate in the implementation of global IT projects of Tencent Overseas IT, and can adapt to the local business need of Europe, and contribute to the output of European IT products and solutions. - Be the expert and first point of contact for a certain product and area of IT, such as cloud products, business systems or infrastructure. - Proactive attitude, able to accept the mission and execute it independently, strong sense of ownership - Can use scripting languages, support automated system deployment and operation & maintenance practices in Europe IT team. - Work with business department to coordinate important system maintenance, changes and IT requirements from business side. - Support R&D lab servers, including server installation, configuration and daily maintenance. - Align with continuous improvement program focused on business value, process optimization, cost avoidance, cost reductions and IT “Speed to Market. ” - Consolidate overseas IT knowledge documents in one place for overseas users’ self-help and regional peer support. - As a member, participate in local software development projects led by a software engineer, including develop, build and deploy applications for our internal and external users in Europe. - Other IT tasks arranged by the IT manager, including office IT construction, system deployment, changes and upgrades, etc.
qualifications: - Bachelor’s degree in Business (Management Information Systems), Computer Science, Business (Other) or equivalent. - 3+ years of working experience in providing technical IT system support to ensure smooth and effective delivery of IT services. - 3+ years of experience working with global IT teams and delivering towards global+local business / IT needs. - 1 + years of experience in software development and knowledge of development methodologies. - Experience with a variety of programming languages such as C, Java or python. - Strong knowledge of ITIL Service Management concepts and experience managing ITIL processes - Knowledge of collaborative productivity tools, for example, but not limited to, instant messaging, collaboration, workspace, knowledge management, issue resolution, ticketing is preferred. - Knowledge of IT compliance and global regulations in data security, cyber security, and privacy is preferred. - Experience with ServiceNow, Workday, Jamf, Faronics, Slack, WeCom is preferred. - Fluent in English, Chinese is preferred but not required, Other EU language skill is a plus

title: Data Engineer Intern
responsibilities: Responsibilities - Work with cross-functional teams and understand how data platform are developed and maintained at scale. - Build scalable data pipelines (using Spark, Airflow and Presto) to move data from different applications into our data warehouse. - Monitor and improve automated solutions to ensure quality and performance SLAs are met. - Maintain and support existing platforms and evolve to newer technology stacks and architectures.
qualifications: Qualifications - Currently pursuing a Bachelors or Masters degree in Computer Science, Data Engineering, or a related field. - Coding & scripting proficiency in languages such as Python, C++, Golang. - SQL knowledge in handling volumes of data and performance. Bonus - Passion in gaming. - Scratch-build a highly scalable, available, fault-tolerant data processing systems using cloud technologies, HDFS, YARN, Map-Reduce, Hive, Kafka, Spark, and other big data technologies.

title: Senior Cybersecurity Engineer
responsibilities: Tencent Overseas IT has the mission to empower Tencent’s rapid global growth with future ready, global IT platforms, applications, and services. We are chartered to lead the Overseas IT strategy, architecture, roadmap, and execution. Satisfying our internal / external customers and becoming a world class global IT team are our top aspirations. Compliance and Security of Overseas IT focus on building a secured and compliant infrastructure to provide our game studios. Our team will partner with Cloud Center of Excellence, Cybersecurity Legal, Privacy office and different Business Group to deliver the best cloud and on-premises solution. We are seeking a Senior cybersecurity Engineer to design and implement Security vulnerability program for our Game Studio, making sure our infrastructures are secure and compliant.
qualifications: This role will work closely with our internal IT and Tencent cloud product teams, as well as our game studios to build the best Cybersecurity program. This role will be responsible of running vulnerability and penetration tests, build automated security control, conduct security assessment, and provide guidance on how to secure game studio’s on-prem and cloud systems. The scope includes enable game studio to be compliant with local regulation by implementing appropriate security and privacy controls. In addition, collaborate with different stakeholder to create a clear Cybersecurity standard, guideline, and documentation to be replicated in future implementation.

title: IEG - Senior Business Intelligence Manager (West EU), Tencent Games
responsibilities: Build the BI framework to track key regional trends within pc, console and mobile games markets throughout the W. EU region. Frequent collaboration with product teams at both strategic and operational levels, ensuring insights are integrated into day-to-day decision making. Support various ad hoc research and insights requests around the regional organisation as needed. Lead our regional relationship with a variety of data providers including Sensor Tower, New Zoo, App Annie, M Science and NPD. Co-ordinate with Tencent’s HQ team in Shenzhen as well as the BI leads in other regions to deliver the most effective frameworks, tools and insights to the organisation. Prepare and present regional insights and trends to the Western European organisation on a quarterly basis. Close collaboration with regional forecasting lead to ensure forecast scenarios are built using clear and appropriate market data. On a twice annual basis, prepare and present regional market insights, trends and forecasts to Tencent owned & part-owned studios developing PC & console games. Identify new tools, systems and insight techniques to continually evolve our organisational capabilities and drive the business. Be an ambassador for Tencent games when dealing with external organisations. Travel (as necessary) to international locations as a representative of Tencent Games.
qualifications: Bachelor’s degree or above in a field applicable to the role. Excellent English language skills. >5 years of experience working in a Business Intelligence function for a major brand or organisation, ideally in the digital entertainment sector. Experience developing and reporting insights in a region / multiple markets. Ability to present clearly & effectively at senior management level as well as in smaller team settings. Excellent relationship builder who quickly builds trust through active listening and by consistently delivering on his / her commitments. Strong influencing skills and a proven ability to use build consensus within cross functional teams. Natural drive to ensure insights are put into action across the business by team members and not just presented then forgotten. Passionate, committed, self-starter with high levels of initiative, energy and ownership. Proactive and approachable personality that thrives in a dynamic team environment. Ambitious and tenacious in nature, able to work autonomously when required and maintain a great sense of humor. Personal passion for video games and digital entertainment. Valid passport and ability to travel as required.

title: Compensation & Benefits Manager
responsibilities: Compensation & Benefits - Setting and review of compensation policies, guidance for South East Asia countries, running discussion points with HQ as well as external benchmarking exercises to ensure our compensation principles have relevance and are competitive in the market; - Review of benefits for the South East Asia region, coming up with localized programs targeting employee life milestones, mental health, insurance and annual leaves while ensuring there is fundamental alignment across the region; - Plan and administer benefits programs for all types of employees including enrolments and terminations; - Serve as an expert on all C&B related matters and act as the point of contact for any queries; - Partner with country HR and legal teams to keep abreast of legislative changes to ensure compliance between Tencent’s offering and with local regulations; Payroll - Responsible for the end to end payroll processes across South East Asia, including processing payroll for all types of employees, data accuracy, process control improvements and ensuring to meet the agreed SLAs - Implement and maintain payroll best practices to improve efficiency and consult with human resources team to improve payroll processes; - Works collaboratively with HQ global payroll team and payroll vendor to prepare payroll reports and required data; - Evaluate and implement payroll systems upgrades and changes; - Fulfill all governmental regulatory mandates (monthly contributions and yearly tax filling, etc); - Q&A with employees Ad-hoc - Participating the HR budget planning every year; - Participate in ad-hoc tasks and a diverse variety of HR projects or initiatives if needed;
qualifications: - Bachelor's degree; - 6-8 years of hands-on payroll, benefits management experience from sizable organizations is preferred; experience in compensation management will be a plus; - Proficient in Singapore labor laws and payroll regulations, enjoys working with large sets of data, is meticulous and detail oriented; - Strategic yet strong execution skills, self-driven, conscientious, strong adaptability and fast learner; - Proven stakeholder management ability; - Ability to work in a highly complex matrixed organization and in a start-up environment; Previous experience within the Tech & Startup sector will be highly sought after; - Ability to communicate bilingually (English / Mandarin) to work with both international stakeholders and China HQ based teammates

title: IEG -Senior Global Broadcast Manager (Esports Center), Tencent Games
responsibilities: Design, execute and develop the local and global approach around our esports broadcasts Design scalable broadcast products and technology integration Work with 3rd party companies and partners to implement and execute regional and global broadcasts Continuously thrive to improve the quality of all our esports broadcasts while looking for the best returns for all invested resources Stay up to date on industry standards, innovation, and latest tech development around broadcast Collaborate closely with the global esports team as well as regional operations teams to establish global and regional product KPIs and measure program success over time Work proactively with the global esports team as well as regional operations teams to develop and implement global esports programs Travel frequently to attend, monitor, and support regional and global tournaments
qualifications: Bachelor’s degree or relevant experience (Television, media, advertisement, etc. ) 7+ years’ experience working in esports & broadcast Proven track record around people & team management Strong autonomous business & strategic thinking as well as pro-activity required Excellent written and oral communication skills in English Strong proficiency in Microsoft Office applications: Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook Strong understanding of various esports eco-systems Impeccable organizational, problem-solving, and time-management abilities Able to act with discretion when handling confidential matters Strong enthusiasm for esports and gaming Capability to travel frequently

title: (Senior) Market & User Research Manager
responsibilities: Primary Duties and Responsibilities / What you’ll get to do: - Conduct research on the video game market and users of Japan. Possible tasks include but are not limited to examining the target audience, identifying cultural trends, uncovering consumer needs, analyzing competitive products, mapping out distribution strategies, and organizing playtests. Formulate research plans independently, collaborate with vendors efficiently, and produce professional reports at the end. - Constantly explore and tap into new connections & resources that are valuable to our research. Keep generating insights into the local video game market and consumers, subsequently translating insights into actionable recommendations for product development, distribution, and improvement.
qualifications: Basic and Preferred Qualifications / What we are looking for: - 5+ years experience in market research; Conversant with various methods including but not limited to qualitative & quantitative research, as well as third-party market database; Capable of conducting research independently. - Expertise in hosting focus group discussions & data analysis. Capable of smoothly communicating with the local people. - Work experience at a video game company or a market research firm is a bonus point. - Proficiency in Japanese is required. Capability of reading and writing English is also required. Competence in Chinese is desired. - Undergraduate or graduate degree in psychology, sociology, marketing, economics, international business, or related field. - Advanced Microsoft Office Software skills, and familiar with data analytics tools such SPSS, SAS, and Tableau. - Strong communication skills. Motivated, team-minded, self-disciplined, and capable of taking on challenges.
